intro: Phyllagathis anisophylla, commonly known as the variable-leaf piper, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, usually elliptical leaves that vary in shape and size. It produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruit is a capsule containing numerous seeds. The botanical features of Phyllagathis anisophylla make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
